definition: to attach as a quality, consequence, or condition
examples: Many privileges were annexed exclusively to royalty.

definition: to add to something earlier, larger, or more important
examples: annexed a bibliography to the thesis

definition: to incorporate (a country or other territory) within the domain of a state
to obtain or take for oneself
something annexed as an expansion or supplement: such as
an added stipulation or statement : appendix
examples: approved the annex in the treaty

definition: a building that is attached to or near a larger building and usually used as part of it : wing
examples: Historical photographs were on view in the library's annex.
